languageKey.label: Maintenance
Switch TYPO3 installation back out of maintenance mode!
Switch TYPO3 installation into maintenance mode!
Maintenance mode FAILED!
Houston, we've Got a Problem! Please check your report module for details and try it again after a reconfiguration.
Maintenance mode ACTIVE!

The maintenance mode of your TYPO3 instance was switched ON.
Let the maintenance work begin!
Maintenance mode INACTIVE!

The maintenance mode of your TYPO3 instance was switched OFF.
We are back, again! Good work!

[BE][adminOnly] Setting: Who has access to the backend during maintenance mode? This setting will be automatically set, if maintenance mode is activated. Value "2" is preferred. Possible values: -1 => total shutdown for maintenance purposes; 0 => normal operation, everyone can login (default); 1 => only admins can login; 2 => only admins and regular CLI users can login.
Setting ['SYS']['devIPmask']
Your DevIPMask is configured correctly. If you switch to maintenance mode, you will see the normal page. Other people will see your nice "We are working for YOU!"-Page :)
You didn`t configured a DevIPMask. Why? It doesn`t hurt. So go to the install tool and set a mask which will be match to your IP address.
Your configured DevIPMask setting doesn`t match your ip address. Why? This is not good. Please, reconfigure it in the install tool.
Setting ['FE']['pageUnavailable_handling']
Do you have a typo? The configured dile was not found! Place it in the configured folder of your document root and all will be fine :)
Standard TYPO3 error page: "Page Not Found - The page did not exist or was inaccessible...". Configure this more userfriendly. You can do it!
You have configured a user function. This function will be called in maintenance mode. Cool!
The configured file will be shown in maintenance mode. Yeah!
The user will be redirected in maintenance mode. Very cool way.
The output of this site will be shown in maintenance mode. Looks good?
Nothing is configured :( So, the standard TYPO3 error page will show a "Page Not Found". Go to install tool and configure this more userfriendly. You can do it!
Setting ['FE']['pageUnavailable_handling_statheader']

Wow! You have configured some nice header! But why is there no "HTTP/1.0 503 Service Temporarily Unavailable"?
Visitors or Google could think you are down for a long time. Set this header and you are on the right side!
Wow! You have configured some nice header! With "HTTP/1.0 503 Service Temporarily Unavailable" nothing can go wrong. Google will come back to you!

No header is configured. Why? Be so nice and configure a header. In this way browser and crawler (like Google-Bot) will be noticed that this site is not down for a long time. So the will be come back. The default / preferred setting is "HTTP/1.0 503 Service Temporarily Unavailable".
